texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Discuss and provide guidance to City Council with regards to providing recommendations to help frame the CIP for FY2019-2028 and beyond
texts.text: Discuss and provide guidance to City Council with regards to providing recommendations to help frame the CIP for FY2019-2028 and beyond

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Assist in development of a report that shall include comments and recommendations that will:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Develop and recommend a long-range CIP with prioritization of City and School facilities utilizing identified available funding
texts.text: Develop and recommend a long-range CIP with prioritization of City and School facilities utilizing identified available funding

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Joint City-Schools Facility Investment Task Force
texts.text: Joint City-Schools Facility Investment Task Force

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Joint Task Force seeks to develop a CIP that:
texts.text: The Joint Task Force seeks to develop a CIP that:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Identifies projects with the highest needs / urgency, are the most ready, and provide the highest value to Alexandria residents.
texts.text: Identifies projects with the highest needs / urgency, are the most ready, and provide the highest value to Alexandria residents.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Master Plan 2. Considers the biggest risks to the portfolio if particular projects are delayed, such as critical life safety needs and required or mandated projects.
texts.text: Master Plan 2. Considers the biggest risks to the portfolio if particular projects are delayed, such as critical life safety needs and required or mandated projects.

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Joint City-Schools Facility Investment Task Force
texts.text: Joint City-Schools Facility Investment Task Force

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The Joint Task Force seeks to develop a CIP that:
texts.text: The Joint Task Force seeks to develop a CIP that:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Provides a strategic city-wide approach that optimizes opportunities and logistical considerations:
texts.text: Provides a strategic city-wide approach that optimizes opportunities and logistical considerations:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) for identifying and acquiring new sites for city and school projects, while being opportunistic as situations may arise;
texts.text: for identifying and acquiring new sites for city and school projects, while being opportunistic as situations may arise;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Master Plan b) implementing related projects together to ensure economies and synergies are realized;
texts.text: Master Plan b) implementing related projects together to ensure economies and synergies are realized;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) implementing an optimal 'swing' approach when a City and/or School facility uses need to be displaced during construction;
texts.text: implementing an optimal 'swing' approach when a City and/or School facility uses need to be displaced during construction;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) addresses projected school overcrowding through the implementation of projects that expand student capacity over time;
texts.text: addresses projected school overcrowding through the implementation of projects that expand student capacity over time;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Considers interim measures (mitigation strategies) if urgency timeframes cannot be met.
texts.text: Considers interim measures (mitigation strategies) if urgency timeframes cannot be met.

texts.text: Joint City-Schools Facility Investment Task Force

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · As of the previous Task Force Meeting, there was a funding gap of more than $120 Million across FY2019 -2027
texts.text: As of the previous Task Force Meeting, there was a funding gap of more than $120 Million across FY2019 -2027

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To facilitate further development and refinement of the FCIP, B&D developed a survey to assist with balancing the FCIP
texts.text: To facilitate further development and refinement of the FCIP, B&D developed a survey to assist with balancing the FCIP

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Master Plan · The survey asked Task Force Members to indicate on a scale of 1 to 5 if they supported removing funding for a particular project within this FCIP
texts.text: Master Plan · The survey asked Task Force Members to indicate on a scale of 1 to 5 if they supported removing funding for a particular project within this FCIP

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The survey asked Task Force Members to indicate how they would fund the high school capacity project
texts.text: The survey asked Task Force Members to indicate how they would fund the high school capacity project

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: Joint City-Schools Facility Investment Task Force
texts.text: Joint City-Schools Facility Investment Task Force

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Members agreed that in order to balance this FCIP, funding could be removed for 7 projects: Firing Range, Pre-K Center, Chinquapin Aquatic Center, Fire Station 206, New Elementary School, Gadsby's Tavern, and reduced funding for the Health Department CFMP
texts.text: Members agreed that in order to balance this FCIP, funding could be removed for 7 projects: Firing Range, Pre-K Center, Chinquapin Aquatic Center, Fire Station 206, New Elementary School, Gadsby's Tavern, and reduced funding for the Health Department CFMP

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Master Plan · Members indicated that funding for Swing Space should be consolidated with funding for a new school -members desire to see capital funds for a temporary swing space utilized as a future permanent school
texts.text: Master Plan · Members indicated that funding for Swing Space should be consolidated with funding for a new school -members desire to see capital funds for a temporary swing space utilized as a future permanent school

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Members indicated that funding for high school construction should occur in FY2021 (or before) in order to provide capacity for the projected peak of 5,000 students in 2023
texts.text: Members indicated that funding for high school construction should occur in FY2021 (or before) in order to provide capacity for the projected peak of 5,000 students in 2023

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Some members indicated Market Square Parking was an opportunity for alternative funding and suggested funding be removed in this FCIP
texts.text: Some members indicated Market Square Parking was an opportunity for alternative funding and suggested funding be removed in this FCIP
